total_revenue.context: Q4 2024 revenue was $9.29 billion, up 11% year-over-year and 10% in constant currency.

full_year_revenue_guidance.context: Fiscal year 2024 revenue guidance raised to $34.75 billion to $34.8 billion, representing 11% projected growth year-over-year.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2024 GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $3.99 to $4, including estimated charges for restructuring of $0.91.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2024 non-GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $8.18 to $8.19.

non_gaap_operating_margin.context: Q4 2024 non-GAAP operating margin was 31.4%, up 220 basis points year-over-year.

full_year_non_gaap_operating_margin_guid.context: Fiscal year 2024 non-GAAP operating margin guidance raised to 30.5%, an improvement of 800 basis points year-over-year.

gaap_operating_margin.context: GAAP operating margin ended the year at 14.4%, up 1,110 basis points year-over-year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Q4 2024 operating cash flow was $3.4 billion, up 22% year-over-year.

free_cash_flow.context: Q4 2024 free cash flow was $3.3 billion, up 27% year-over-year.

full_year_operating_cash_flow.context: Fiscal year 2024 operating cash flow reached $10.2 billion, up 44% year-over-year.

full_year_free_cash_flow.context: Fiscal year 2024 free cash flow was $9.5 billion, up 50% year-over-year.

capital_expenditures.context: Fiscal year 2024 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2.5% of revenue.

records_ingested.context: In Q4, 7 trillion records were ingested into Data Cloud.

activations.context: In Q4, 1 trillion activations were triggered to drive customer engagement.

fortune_100_customers.context: 17% of the Fortune 100 are now Einstein GPT Copilot customers.

trailhead_learners.context: Salesforce has 18 million Trailblazers in its community.

transformation_plan.description: Accelerated transformation to profitable growth focusing on restructuring, productivity, operational excellence, core innovations, shareholder relationships, and AI transformation.
initiatives: Short-term and long-term restructuring, including headcount reductions and real estate consolidation.
Reigniting performance culture by focusing on productivity, operational excellence, and profitability.
Prioritizing core innovations and integrating acquisitions like MuleSoft, Tableau, and Slack.
Building stronger relationships with investors through enhanced communication and share repurchase programs.
Driving AI transformation with the launch of Einstein Copilot and Prompt Builder.
goals: Achieve non-GAAP operating margins of 30.5% in FY '24 and exceed 30% in Q1 '25.
Accelerate transformation timeline to exceed 2-year goals.
Enhance shareholder value by initiating the first-ever dividend and increasing share repurchase authorization to $30 billion.
Democratize generative AI at scale for customers through integrated AI products.
examples: Closed fiscal year '24 with $34.9 billion in revenue, up 11% YoY.
Non-GAAP operating margin of 30.5%, up 800 basis points YoY.
Operating cash flow reached $10.2 billion, up 44% YoY.
Introduced the first-ever dividend of $0.40 per quarter.
Increased share repurchase plan by $10 billion, total authorization now $30 billion.

market_position.description: Salesforce remains the #1 CRM provider by market share and is rapidly advancing to become the #1 AI CRM.
initiatives: Maintaining leadership in CRM across sales, service, marketing, commerce, communities, integration, and app development.
Integrating Slack into the Customer 360 platform to enhance collaboration capabilities.
Expanding partnerships with AWS to deepen integrations and enhance product offerings.
goals: Enhance collaboration and communication through Slack integration.
Become the #1 AI CRM in the industry.
examples: Salesforce became the third largest enterprise software company globally and the second largest in Japan.
Strengthened partnerships with AWS to deliver integrated data and AI solutions.
Received top rankings in industry reports like the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Customer Data Platforms.

innovation.description: Focus on Einstein 1 Platform, AI innovations like Einstein Copilot, and integration of Data Cloud to drive customer success.
initiatives: Enhancing Einstein 1 Platform to provide unified customer views and AI-driven insights.
Launching Einstein Copilot to offer conversational AI assistance across Salesforce applications.
Integrating Data Cloud deeply into all Salesforce apps to unlock trapped data and provide a single source of truth.
goals: Empower customers with AI and data-driven capabilities.
Provide unified customer experiences through integrated AI platforms.
Drive workforce development and ecosystem growth with innovative AI tools.
examples: Einstein Copilot released to customers, providing real-time insights and action plans.
Data Cloud achieved 7 trillion records ingested and 1 trillion activations in Q4.
TrailheaDX to showcase new AI innovations and product enhancements.

ecosystem_development.description: Growth of Salesforce ecosystem through Trailhead, strategic partnerships, and integration of Slack and other products.
initiatives: Expanding Trailhead to support continuous learning and reskilling.
Strengthening strategic partnerships with global brands like IBM, Amazon, Microsoft, and Hugging Face.
Enhancing Slack to support collaborative and sustainable work environments with new AI features.
goals: Create more than 3 million jobs and $860 billion in GDP impact worldwide by 2022.
Provide over 1 million Americans with Salesforce credentials.
Contribute to 4.2 million new jobs and $1.2 trillion in new business revenues worldwide from 2019 through 2024.
examples: Partnership with AWS to deliver integrated data and AI solutions.
Salesforce Starter introduced for small businesses, adding 3,000 new logos.
Collaborations with companies like ADP, Intel, McLaren, and Sonos leveraging Einstein 1.

social_initiatives.description: Enhanced support for nonprofits, commitment to sustainability, and integration of Slack.
initiatives: Delivering $450 million in grants and 6 million volunteer hours.
Achieving net zero gas emissions globally and providing a carbon-neutral cloud to customers.
Committing to 100% renewable energy for global operations by 2022.
Integrating Slack to support collaborative and sustainable work environments.
goals: Empower nonprofit, education, and philanthropy customers to fulfill their missions.
Reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
examples: Salesforce.org supporting 51,000 nonprofits with free services.
$450 million in grants delivered to various causes.
Carbon-neutral cloud and commitment to renewable energy initiatives.

revenue_growth.expectation: Continued growth driven by multi-cloud adoption, industry solutions, and geographical expansion despite economic headwinds.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to remain strong or accelerate in upcoming quarters.
factors: Growth in Salesforce platform and cloud services.
Successful integration of acquisitions like MuleSoft and Tableau.
Increased demand for digital transformation and customer experience solutions.

revenue.context: Fiscal year 2025 revenue guidance of $37.7 billion to $38 billion, representing 8% to 9% projected growth year-over-year.

non_gaap_operating_margin.context: Fiscal year 2025 non-GAAP operating margin guidance of 32.5%, representing a 200 basis point improvement year-over-year.

gaap_operating_margin.context: Fiscal year 2025 GAAP operating margin guidance of 20.4%, representing a 600 basis point improvement year-over-year.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2025 GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $6.07 to $6.15.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2025 non-GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $9.68 to $9.76.

operating_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year 2025 operating cash flow growth expected to be approximately 21% to 24% year-over-year, including a 10-point year-over-year headwind from cash taxes.

capital_expenditures.context: Fiscal year 2025 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2% of revenue.

free_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year 2025 free cash flow growth expected to be approximately 23% to 26%.

revenue.context: Q1 2025 revenue guidance of $9.12 billion to $9.17 billion, up 11% year-over-year in nominal and 12% in constant currency.

crpo_growth.context: Q1 2025 CRPO growth expected to be 11% year-over-year in nominal and 12% in constant currency.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q1 2025 GAAP EPS guidance of $1.42 to $1.44.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q1 2025 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $2.37 to $2.39.

drivers: Investments in AI and Data Cloud.
Continued investment in commercial sales capacity.

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged excluding Salesforce.org-related expenses.

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud and AI.
Strategic acquisitions to enhance product offerings.

capital_expenditures_guidance.context: Fiscal year 2024 and 2025 CapEx expected to be slightly below 2.5% and 2% of revenue respectively.

operating_environment_challenges: Integration of Genie and Slack acquisitions.
Managing foreign exchange (FX) headwinds impacting revenue growth.
Balancing investments in cloud and AI with profitability.
Adapting to competitive pressures in cloud and CRM markets.
Scaling operations to support rapid growth in key segments like Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
Ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and geopolitical tensions on operations, customer behavior, and economic conditions.
